div.p: Diagrams showing by how many percent each of 11 size measures of P. ater from 11 sampling places differs from the P. ater reference sample from SW Sweden. Tarsus refers to tarsus ‘short’. P. ater coexists with P. cristatus and P. montanus on the Swedish mainland and on the Finnish island of Åland. On the Danish penisnsula Jylland it coexists with P. cristatus and on the island of Öland with P. montanus. But on the six islands Gotska Sandön, Gotland, Bornholm, Sjælland, Anholt and Læsø P. cristatus as well as P. montanus are totally lacking.
